questions: Define set with two examples.
Write the members of A = {x : x is a natural number less than 7}.
State whether the following collections are sets or not: (a) The rivers of Nepal (b) Ten most talented students of grade VI.
Express the set P = {Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday} in set builder form.
If P = {a, e, i, o, u} and Q = {a, b, c, d}, write the common elements of P and Q.
Define the following with examples: (a) Empty set (b) Singleton set (c) Equivalent sets (d) Equal sets.
In a survey of 100 students, 60 students like tea and 50 students like coffee. If 30 students like both drinks, find the number of students who do not like both tea and coffee.
Out of 50 students, 28 students like to play cricket and 25 students like to play football. If 5 students do not like to play both games, how many students like to play both games?
If n(U) = 80, n(A) = 50, n(B) = 40 and n(A ∩ B) = 15, find n(A ∪ B)'.
State whether the following are true or false: (a) Every set is a subset of itself (b) The empty set is a subset of every set.
If P = {1, 3, 5, 7}, find all the subsets of P.
Represent A ∩ (B ∪ C) in Venn-diagram.
Find the cardinal number of set M = {x : x is a multiple of 5 between 20 and 50}.
Which is the smallest whole number?
Is there any greatest whole number?
Write the successor and predecessor of 99.
Find the product of the greatest number of three digits and the smallest number of one digit.
Find the difference of the greatest and the smallest numbers formed by the digits 9, 4, 0, 7, 3.
Simplify: 48 ÷ 6 + 8 × 2 − 5.
Find the value of: 125 ÷ 25 × 5 + 8 − 2.
Divide the sum of 568 and 234 by their difference.
The product of two numbers is 2880. If one number is 48, find the other number.
State whether the following statements are true or false: (a) Whole numbers are closed under subtraction (b) Division by zero is not defined.
Find the quotient and remainder when 7894 is divided by 87.
If 56 × 98 = 5488, find the value of 560 × 98 without actual multiplication.
Verify the commutative property of addition for 37 and 28.
Write any five negative integers.
Write the absolute value of −15 and +15.
Represent the integers −4, 0, 3, 5, −2 on a number line.
Find the sum of −25 and 18.
Subtract −13 from 8.
Find the product of −7 and −9.
Divide −56 by 8.
The sum of two integers is −15. If one integer is 8, find the other integer.
The product of two integers is −72. If one integer is 9, find the other integer.
State the additive inverse of −11.
Which is greater: −5 or −8?
Arrange in ascending order: −3, 0, −7, 5, −1.
If a = −4, b = 5 and c = −2, find the value of a + b − c.
Define proper fraction and improper fraction with examples.
Convert 23/5 into mixed number.
Convert 4 3/7 into improper fraction.
Find the equivalent fraction of 3/4 with denominator 20.
Reduce 36/48 to its lowest terms.
Compare: 5/8 and 7/12.
Arrange in ascending order: 2/3, 5/6, 3/4.
Find the sum of 3/5 and 2/7.
Subtract 5/9 from 7/12.
Find the product of 4/7 and 3/8.
Divide 5/6 by 2/3.
A rope is 12 3/4 m long. If 5 1/2 m is cut off, how much rope is left?
Find the reciprocal of 7/11.
If 2/5 of a number is 18, find the number.
Multiply 2 3/4 by 1 2/3.
What fraction of an hour is 25 minutes?
Express 0.75 as a fraction in simplest form.
Write 0.35 in words.
Write 'twenty-three and forty-five hundredths' in decimal form.
Convert 7/8 into decimal.
Convert 0.625 into fraction.
Compare: 0.45 and 0.405.
Arrange in ascending order: 0.8, 0.08, 0.008, 0.88.
Subtract 8.456 from 15.2.
Multiply 3.24 by 0.5.
Divide 15.75 by 2.5.
Multiply 0.125 by 100.
Divide 45.6 by 0.01.
Express 3/8 as a decimal and round off to two decimal places.
If 1 kg of rice costs Rs. 65.50, find the cost of 3.5 kg of rice.
A book costs Rs. 125.75 and a pen costs Rs. 35.50. Find the total cost.
Round off 23.456 to the nearest tenth.
Convert 2.36 m into centimeters.
Express 2 1/4 as a decimal.
If 5 pens cost Rs. 75, find the cost of 8 pens.
If 12 workers can complete a work in 15 days, how many days will 18 workers take to complete the same work?
A car travels 240 km in 4 hours. How far will it travel in 7 hours at the same speed?
If 6 kg of sugar costs Rs. 300, find the cost of 1 kg of sugar.
If 15 books weigh 6 kg, what is the weight of 25 books?
A train covers 150 km in 2 hours. What is its speed in km/hr?
If 8 meters of cloth costs Rs. 360, find the cost of 5 meters of cloth.
20 men can dig a pond in 12 days. How many days will 15 men take to dig the same pond?
If the cost of 3 dozen bananas is Rs. 180, find the cost of 5 bananas.
A machine produces 1500 items in 5 hours. How many items will it produce in 8 hours?
If 4 taps can fill a tank in 3 hours, how long will 6 taps take to fill the same tank?
The cost of 7 kg of rice is Rs. 350. Find the cost of 1 kg and 15 kg of rice.
If 25 students can be seated in 5 rows, how many students can be seated in 8 rows?
A cyclist covers 45 km in 3 hours. How much time will he take to cover 75 km at the same speed?
If 10 identical articles cost Rs. 650, find the cost of 7 such articles.
Convert 3/5 into percentage.
Convert 65% into fraction in simplest form.
Convert 0.85 into percentage.
Find 25% of 160.
What percent of 80 is 20?
15 is what percent of 60?
If 40% of a number is 80, find the number.
In a class of 50 students, 60% are boys. Find the number of girls.
A shopkeeper marks his goods 20% above the cost price. If the cost price is Rs. 500, find the marked price.
The price of a shirt is Rs. 800. If there is a discount of 15%, find the sale price.
Ram scored 432 marks out of 600. Find his percentage of marks.
The population of a town is 25000. If 52% are males, find the number of females.
Convert 7/8 into percentage.
What is 12.5% of Rs. 2400?
In an examination, Sita got 85% marks. If the maximum marks are 500, how many marks did she get?
A man spends 75% of his income. If he saves Rs. 6000, find his income.
The price of petrol is increased by 10%. If the original price was Rs. 120 per liter, find the new price.
In a school, there are 480 students. If 45% are girls, find the number of boys.
Express 1.25 as a percentage.
Find the increase percent when a number increases from 50 to 65.
Define cost price and selling price.
A shopkeeper buys an article for Rs. 500 and sells it for Rs. 600. Find his profit.
An article is bought for Rs. 800 and sold for Rs. 720. Find the loss.
If CP = Rs. 250 and profit = Rs. 50, find the selling price.
If SP = Rs. 450 and loss = Rs. 30, find the cost price.
Find the profit percent when CP = Rs. 400 and SP = Rs. 480.
Find the loss percent when CP = Rs. 600 and SP = Rs. 540.
A bicycle is bought for Rs. 2500 and sold at a profit of 12%. Find the selling price.
A TV is sold for Rs. 18000 at a loss of 10%. Find the cost price.
If the cost price of 10 pens is equal to the selling price of 8 pens, find the profit percent.
A shopkeeper bought 20 kg of rice at Rs. 40 per kg and sold it at Rs. 45 per kg. Find his total profit.
By selling a fan for Rs. 1440, a man gains 20%. Find the cost price of the fan.
A trader bought goods worth Rs. 5000 and spent Rs. 500 on transportation. If he sells the goods for Rs. 6600, find his profit percent.
If selling price is double the cost price, what is the profit percent?
An article is sold at a loss of 25%. If the cost price is Rs. 800, find the selling price.
Find the SP when CP = Rs. 1250 and loss% = 8%.
A man bought 50 dozen bananas at Rs. 30 per dozen. 5 dozen bananas were rotten. He sold the remaining at Rs. 36 per dozen. Find his profit or loss percent.
If the CP of 15 books is equal to SP of 12 books, find the gain percent.
A shopkeeper marks an article 25% above the cost price and allows a discount of 10%. Find his gain percent.
What is the difference between profit and profit percent?
Define principal, rate, time and simple interest.
Find the simple interest on Rs. 5000 at 8% per annum for 2 years.
Find the simple interest on Rs. 12000 at 10% per annum for 3 years.
Calculate the amount when principal = Rs. 8000, rate = 12% and time = 2 years.
If SI = Rs. 480, rate = 8% and time = 3 years, find the principal.
If SI = Rs. 900, principal = Rs. 6000 and time = 3 years, find the rate.
If SI = Rs. 1200, principal = Rs. 8000 and rate = 10%, find the time.
A sum of Rs. 15000 is lent at 9% per annum. Find the simple interest for 4 years.
What sum will amount to Rs. 6600 in 2 years at 10% per annum simple interest?
At what rate percent per annum will Rs. 4000 amount to Rs. 5200 in 3 years?
In how many years will Rs. 7500 amount to Rs. 9000 at 5% per annum simple interest?
Find the principal if simple interest for 5 years at 8% per annum is Rs. 2000.
The simple interest on a certain sum for 3 years at 12% per annum is Rs. 1800. Find the sum.
A man borrowed Rs. 20000 at 7.5% per annum simple interest. How much interest will he pay after 2 years?
Find the amount on Rs. 6400 at 12.5% per annum for 3 years.
Divide Rs. 3600 into two parts such that the simple interest on the first part for 4 years at 8% equals the simple interest on the second part for 2 years at 12%.
What principal will earn Rs. 1440 as simple interest in 3 years at 6% per annum?
At what rate percent will a sum double itself in 10 years?
In how many years will a sum triple itself at 10% per annum simple interest?
Find the difference between simple interest on Rs. 5000 at 8% for 3 years and at 6% for 4 years.
Express the ratio 45:60 in simplest form.
Find the ratio of 2.5 kg to 500 g.
Divide Rs. 1200 in the ratio 3:5.
If a:b = 2:3 and b:c = 4:5, find a:b:c.
Find the fourth proportional to 3, 6, 9.
Find the third proportional to 4 and 8.
Find the mean proportional between 9 and 16.
If 4:5 = x:35, find the value of x.
Check whether 3, 6, 9, 18 are in proportion.
The ratio of boys to girls in a school is 7:5. If there are 420 boys, find the number of girls.
Two numbers are in the ratio 5:7. If their sum is 144, find the numbers.
Divide 560 into three parts in the ratio 2:3:3.
The ages of father and son are in the ratio 8:3. If the father is 40 years old, find the age of the son.
If 15 workers can complete a work in 12 days, how many workers are needed to complete the same work in 9 days?
A and B are in the ratio 4:5. If A = 28, find B.
Compare the ratios 2:3 and 5:8.
Express the ratio 75 cm to 2 m in simplest form.
If a:b = 3:4 and b:c = 5:6, find a:c.
Three numbers are in the ratio 2:3:5 and their sum is 500. Find the numbers.
The monthly incomes of A and B are in the ratio 5:4 and their monthly expenditures are in the ratio 7:5. If each saves Rs. 3000, find their monthly incomes.
Define point, line and plane.
Draw a line segment AB of length 5 cm.
Define acute angle, obtuse angle, right angle and reflex angle.
Draw an angle of 60° using compass and ruler.
If two angles are complementary and one angle is 35°, find the other angle.
If two angles are supplementary and one angle is 115°, find the other angle.
Find the complement of 63°.
Find the supplement of 128°.
What is the measure of each angle of an equilateral triangle?
Define vertically opposite angles with diagram.
If two adjacent angles are in the ratio 2:3 and their sum is 180°, find the angles.
The angles of a triangle are in the ratio 2:3:4. Find the angles.
One angle of a triangle is 70° and the other two angles are equal. Find the angles.
Define parallel lines and perpendicular lines.
Draw perpendicular bisector of a line segment of length 6 cm.
Bisect an angle of 80° using compass.
If one angle of a right triangle is 35°, find the other acute angle.
What is the sum of all angles of a triangle?
Define collinear points and concurrent lines.
Name the types of triangles based on sides and angles.
Find the perimeter of a rectangle with length 12 cm and breadth 8 cm.
Find the area of a rectangle whose length is 15 m and breadth is 10 m.
The perimeter of a square is 48 cm. Find its side.
Find the area of a square whose side is 9 cm.
Find the perimeter of a triangle with sides 5 cm, 7 cm and 9 cm.
The length of a rectangle is 18 cm and its area is 144 cm². Find its breadth.
A rectangular field is 40 m long and 25 m wide. Find the cost of fencing it at Rs. 15 per meter.
Find the area of a triangle with base 12 cm and height 8 cm.
The perimeter of a rectangular garden is 80 m. If its length is 25 m, find its breadth.
How many tiles of size 20 cm × 30 cm will be required to cover a floor of size 6 m × 4 m?
The area of a square field is 625 m². Find the length of its side.
Find the length of diagonal of a rectangle whose length is 15 cm and breadth is 8 cm.
A path 2 m wide runs around the outside of a rectangular garden 15 m long and 10 m wide. Find the area of the path.
The ratio of length to breadth of a rectangle is 5:3. If its perimeter is 96 cm, find its length and breadth.
Find the area of a parallelogram with base 14 cm and height 9 cm.
The area of a square and rectangle are equal. If the side of square is 12 cm and length of rectangle is 16 cm, find the breadth of rectangle.
A wire is bent to form a square of side 11 cm. If the same wire is bent to form a rectangle of length 13 cm, find its breadth.
Find the perimeter of an equilateral triangle whose side is 7.5 cm.
Calculate the cost of carpeting a room 8 m long and 6 m wide at Rs. 250 per m².
